title: 50+ Hinge Responses to the Most Popular Prompts for Guys

steps.title: This is a great way to show your personality and dating style.
steps.content: This is a great way to show your personality and dating style. Improve your Hinge profile by taking a humorous approach. Try comparing yourself to scenarios that don’t really have anything to do with dating. Here are some possible answers: “Finding out school was canceled and you get to sleep in.” “Seeing your dog after a long day at work.” “Waking up after a night out without a hangover.”

steps.title: Using this prompt shows that you’re goal-oriented.
steps.content: Using this prompt shows that you’re goal-oriented. Whether your goals are personal or professional, this prompt shows that you have ambition and are ready to get the ball rolling. Your potential match might even have the same goal, and you can achieve it together. [1] X Research source Here are some possible answers: “Go to a Taylor Swift concert” “Visit Europe. I’ve never been!” “Learn to speak Spanish fluently”

steps.title: This prompt is a great way to find fellow travelers.
steps.content: This prompt is a great way to find fellow travelers. If traveling is an important part of your life, you want to find someone to join you on your adventures. Maybe your potential matches have been to the same places or have had a similar experience. Now, you two can talk about your craziest experiences. [2] X Research source Here are some examples: “Seeing a lion on a safari.” “Riding a camel in Egypt.” “Seeing my favorite artwork at the Met.”

steps.title: Use this prompt to share a hidden talent or interest.
steps.content: Use this prompt to share a hidden talent or interest. A picture might be worth a thousand words, but you can’t know everything about a person just by looking at their profile pictures. Share a fun fact people might not realize based on your profile. [3] X Research source The possibilities are endless, but here are some examples: “I’m really good at juggling.” “I can speak three languages.” “I collect snowglobes.”

steps.title: This guessing game is a fun way to break the ice.
steps.content: This guessing game is a fun way to break the ice. Playing two truths and a lie invites potential matches to start the conversation, and it gives you a perfect opportunity to share a fun, outlandish story. Try to think of some truths that are unique to you. Avoid simple answers like “My favorite food is pizza” or “My favorite color is blue.” Maybe you have a crazy vacation story or maybe you’re a professional bagpiper. Try to think outside the box! If you have trouble coming up with a lie, try altering something that actually happened to you. For example, if you were an extra in an episode of Game of Thrones , say you were an extra in New Girl instead. Then, when you reveal your answers, you have a third fun fact to talk about!

steps.title: This prompt lets your matches see how you prioritize your free time.
steps.content: This prompt lets your matches see how you prioritize your free time. Do you prefer to sleep in and relax or do you go for a jog at 6 am? Answer this prompt to find someone who enjoys their free time in a similar way. [4] X Research source Here are some ways you can answer: “Reading in bed and snuggling with my cat.” “Hitting the gym and cooking a healthy breakfast.” “Spending time with family and trying to ignore the Sunday Scaries.”

steps.title: Meeting people can be hard, so why not make it easy?
steps.content: Meeting people can be hard, so why not make it easy? This prompt allows your potential matches to understand your personality and how you approach getting to know people. Don’t be afraid to let people see the real you! [5] X Research source Here are some examples: “Looking at my Spotify playlists.” “Asking deep questions.” “Spending time with me. I open up more in person.”

steps.title: Everyone has a nerdy side, so don’t be afraid to show it.
steps.content: Everyone has a nerdy side, so don’t be afraid to show it. By sharing your dorky side with potential matches, you’ll find someone who won’t judge you and might even geek out with you. [6] X Research source Here are some possible answers: “I’m obsessed with the New York Times puzzles.” “I can recite Shakespeare’s sonnets.” “I have a Star Trek tattoo on my back.”

steps.title: Use this prompt if you actually want to follow through.
steps.content: Use this prompt if you actually want to follow through. Answering this question shows potential matches that you’re willing to actually meet up for a date. If someone fits your qualifications, take them out for drinks and see where it goes. Here are some ideas to get you started: “You listen to 90s R&B.” “You’re willing to listen to me talk about Star Wars for hours.” “You’ll sing karaoke with me.”

steps.title: This prompt opens up date possibilities.
steps.content: This prompt opens up date possibilities. It shows that you’ve put thought into fun date ideas and are ready to meet someone in person. Your answer could be something immediate or a goal for a long-term relationship. This will help you find a match who’s straightforward and ready to take things off the app. Here are some answers to consider: “Make all our single friends jealous.” “Set a new high score at an escape room.” “Eat at every pizza place in town.”

steps.title: Be upfront with what you want to get out of Hinge.
steps.content: Be upfront with what you want to get out of Hinge. Whether you’re looking for something casual or a lifelong commitment, it’s important to be honest with your potential matches. This way, you can both save time and match with someone who wants the same thing. [7] X Research source Here are some examples: “Someone to show me around the city. I just moved here!” “Something casual. Want to get drinks and see where it goes?” “A long-term relationship. I’m ready to settle down.”

steps.title: Ask your matches questions about themselves.
steps.content: Ask your matches questions about themselves. While it’s fun to answer prompts about yourself, remember that you’re trying to get to know other people, too. Use this question to start a conversation and learn more about your matches. [8] X Research source Here are some examples: “What your favorite cartoon as a kid was.” “What your zodiac sign is.” “What you would do with a million dollars.”

steps.title: Use this prompt to find matches you’re truly compatible with.
steps.content: Use this prompt to find matches you’re truly compatible with. Many people prioritize matching with those who have similar beliefs and goals. Increase your chances of a date by matching with people with similar values. [9] X Research source Here are some potential answers: “Cats vs. dogs. Which one is better?” “Our political beliefs.” “If we want kids in the future.”

steps.title: This prompt allows you to be funny and vulnerable.
steps.content: This prompt allows you to be funny and vulnerable. If you have an embarrassing fear, share it with the world! Maybe your matches won’t think it’s irrational at all or maybe they have an even sillier fear. [10] X Research source Here are some examples: “Getting sucked down a bathtub drain” “Thomas the Tank Engine” “Burning the roof of my mouth while eating pizza”

steps.title: This prompt invites matches to prove you wrong.
steps.content: This prompt invites matches to prove you wrong. If you say they can’t do something, they’ll respond just to tell you they can. Then, you can ask them to prove it in person and you’ve got a date! Here are some suggestions: “Eat more sushi than me.” “Wiggle your ears.” “Beat me at Mario Kart.”

steps.title: Let your matches know you have a great place for a date.
steps.content: Let your matches know you have a great place for a date. Maybe you know the best hole-in-the-wall restaurant or a nice spot in the park for a picnic. This prompt will interest anyone new to the area or looking to try something new. [11] X Research source Check out these examples: “All-you-can-eat sushi.” “Finding vintage items at thrift stores.” “Watching the sunset.”

steps.title: Keep your answer light to encourage playful banter.
steps.content: Keep your answer light to encourage playful banter. This might not be the best prompt for voicing your opinions on serious matters, but it’s a fun way to encourage a debate. People can be passionate about silly things, so make your opinions known! Here are some highly debated topics for you to consider: “DC is better than Marvel.” “Winter is the best season.” “Disney is overrated.”

steps.title: Let your matches know your musical preferences with this prompt.
steps.content: Let your matches know your musical preferences with this prompt. This prompt shows your matches that you’re confident, fun, and not afraid to embarrass yourself. It also gives them an idea of your music taste. They’ll know a night out with you is sure to be filled with fun and laughter. Here are some example answers: “‘Bohemian Rhapsody’. I love a challenge.” “Anything by Beyoncé. She’s my favorite.” “‘Jolene’ by Dolly Parton. It’s a classic!”

steps.title: Show your matches your compassionate side.
steps.content: Show your matches your compassionate side. We often try to make our dating profiles funny to stand out, but it’s important to share things you truly care about, as well. If you volunteer or support any organizations or causes, now’s the time to share. You might find someone with similar values. [12] X Research source Here are some possible answers: “Feeding the hungry.” “Volunteering at animal shelters.” “Encouraging people to vote.”

steps.title: This prompt shows your matches how fun you are.
steps.content: This prompt shows your matches how fun you are. People are attracted to those who are exciting and willing to take risks. Using this prompt will help you find potential matches who will keep you on your toes. [13] X Research source Some example answers include: “Driving 8 hours because I wanted Chicago pizza.” “Quitting my job and backpacking through Europe for six months.” “Going skydiving on a random Tuesday afternoon.” Wondering what the best Hinge prompts are?
